required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fasting Versus Non-Fasting for Cardiac Implantable Electronic Devices (FastCIED Study)
clinical_study.official_title: Fasting Versus Non-Fasting for Cardiac Implantable Electronic Devices (FastCIED Study)

brief_summary.textblock: There was no evidence to suggest that a shortened fluid fast results in an increased risk of aspiration, regurgitation or related morbidity compared with the standard 'nil by mouth from midnight' fasting policy. However, there is no available data regarding the safety and efficacy of fasting approach in patients undergoing cardiac implantable electronic device (CIED) procedures. The aim of this study is to demonstrate that a non-fasting protocol is non-inferior in regard to safety to a fasting protocol (current practice) in patients undergoing cardiac device implantation procedures

primary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 24 hours after the procedure
primary_outcome.description: Post-interventional patients well-being including (to be assessed by questionnaire with the help of a Numeric Rating Scale (rang: 0-10, higher scores mean a worse outcome): abdominal pain, thirst, mouth dryness, headache, anxiety, hunger, nausea, vomiting, tiredness and weakness, dizziness Incidence of Intra -procedural adverse events like emergency intubation and perioperative pulmonary aspiration vomiting)

secondary_outcome.measure: Usages of inotropic and vasopressor agents
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of used inotropic and vasopressor agents during the intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of used sedative agents during the intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of used analgesics agents during the intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of used anti-vomiting agents during the intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour pre-procedural, during the first 24 hours after the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Serum creatinine (mg/dL)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour pre-procedural, during the first 24 hours after the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Serum urea (mg/dL)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour pre-procedural, during the first 24 hours after the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: GFR is Glomerular Filtration Rate and it is a key indicator of renal function. eGFR is estimated GFR and is a mathematically derived entity based on a patient's serum creatinine level, age, sex and race.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-intervention, and then every 15 minutes during the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate (frequency per minute) will be assessed by using a monitoring device

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-intervention, and then every 15 minutes during the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Oxygen saturation (%) will be assessed by using a monitoring device

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-intervention, and then every 15 minutes during the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure (mmHg) will be assessed by using a monitoring device

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour pre-procedural
secondary_outcome.description: Will be assessed by venous blood gas analysis (number).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour pre-procedural
secondary_outcome.description: Will be assessed by venous blood gas analysis (mmHg).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour pre-procedural
secondary_outcome.description: Will be assessed by venous blood gas analysis (mEq/L).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour pre-procedural, pre-intervention, 8 hours after procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Will be assessed by venous blood gas analysis (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour pre-procedural, pre-intervention, 8 hours after procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Will be assessed by blood test.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour pre-procedural, pre-intervention, 8 hours after procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Will be assessed by blood test (mm/L).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 24 hours after the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Patients general satisfaction with procedure as assessed by the patient satisfaction survey form using Numeric Rating Scale (rang: 0-10, higher scores mean a better outcome)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 24 hours after the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Sleep quality based on Numeric Rating Scale (rang: 0-10, higher scores mean a better outcome)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 24 hours after the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Surgical site pain based on Numeric Rating Scale (rang: 0-10, higher scores mean a worse outcome)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Based on the number of ICU stay nights

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Based on the number of ICU stay nights plus ward stay

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 30 days after the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Operation site (Chest) infection rate via Telephone /follow-up visits

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 30 days after the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will then divide the causes into 1) operation related and 2) non-operation related causes

arm_group.description: Clear fluids and food up to up to 1 hour before the procedure
Fasting for solids for up to 6 hours and fluids up to 2 hours before the procedure

intervention.intervention_name: Clear fluids and food up to up to 1 hour before the procedure
intervention.description: Clear fluids and food up to up to 1 hour before the start of the procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients >18 years undergoing elective implantation or generator exchange of cardiac implantable electronic devices
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients presenting with an acute unstable condition (bradycardia < 30/min or temporary pacing wire)
- Patients scheduled for deep sedation
- Patients with increased intra-abdominal pressure (severe intra-abdominal tumors, severe ascites, very severe obesity: BMI>40 kg/m2).
